alert.note: Alert for Whatcom (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued December 05 at 11:46AM PST until December 07 at 12:46AM PST by NWS Seattle
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Seattle WA has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Washington... Nooksack River At Ferndale affecting Whatcom County. Chehalis River Above Grand Mound affecting Grays Harbor and Thurston Counties. .Heavy rainfall has ended in the north Cascades but continues for southwest Washington where another 1-2 inches are expected. The flood waves from the heavy rain since yesterday will drive the lower Nooksack and mid Chehalis River above flood stage. For the North West Region...including Saxon Bridge, North Cedarville, Ferndale, Burlington, Concrete, Mt. Vernon, Arlington, Jordan Rd. Bridge, Arlington...Major flooding is forecast. For the Chehalis River Basin Region...including Bucoda, Centralia, Chehalis, Doty, Centralia, Grand Mound, Porter...Moderate flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM THIS AFTERNOON TO EARLY THURSDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Nooksack River at Ferndale. * WHEN...From this afternoon to early Thursday morning. * IMPACTS...At 18.0 feet, the river begins overtopping its banks within the City of Ferndale flooding low-lying areas within the City and low pasture lands along the river from near Ferndale downstream to the mouth. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:30 AM PST Tuesday the stage was 13.2 feet. - Flood stage is 18.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage late this afternoon to a crest of 19.6 feet late tonight. It will then fall below flood stage tomorrow afternoon. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued by this evening at 800 PM PST.
